an7.54:1.1: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:
an7.54:1.2: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why an educated noble disciple has no doubts regarding the undeclared points?”
an7.54:2.1: “Mendicant, it’s due to the cessation of views that an educated noble disciple has no doubts regarding the undeclared points.
an7.54:2.2: ‘A Realized One exists after death’: this is a misconception.
an7.54:2.3: ‘A Realized One doesn’t exist after death’: this is a misconception.
an7.54:2.4: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’: this is a misconception.
an7.54:2.5: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death’: this is a misconception.
an7.54:2.6: An uneducated ordinary person doesn’t understand views, their origin, their cessation, or the practice that leads to their cessation.
an7.54:2.7: And so their views grow. They’re not freed from rebirth, old age, and death, from sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress. They’re not freed from suffering, I say.
an7.54:3.1: An educated noble disciple does understand views, their origin, their cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation.
an7.54:3.2: And so their views cease. They’re freed from rebirth, old age, and death, from sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress. They’re freed from suffering, I say.
an7.54:3.3: Knowing and seeing this, an educated noble disciple does not answer: ‘A Realized One exists after death’,
an7.54:3.4: ‘a Realized One doesn’t exist after death’,
an7.54:3.5: ‘a Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’,
an7.54:3.6: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’
an7.54:3.7: Knowing and seeing this, an educated noble disciple does not declare the undeclared points.
an7.54:3.8: Knowing and seeing this, an educated noble disciple doesn’t shake, tremble, quake, or get nervous regarding the undeclared points.
an7.54:4.1: ‘A Realized One exists after death’: this is just about craving. …
an7.54:4.6: ‘A Realized One exists after death’: this is a regret.
an7.54:4.7: ‘A Realized One doesn’t exist after death’: this is a regret.
an7.54:4.8: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’: this is a regret.
an7.54:4.9: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death’: this is a regret.
an7.54:4.10: An uneducated ordinary person doesn’t understand regrets, their origin, their cessation, or the practice that leads to their cessation.
an7.54:4.11: And so their regrets grow. They’re not freed from rebirth, old age, and death, from sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress. They’re not freed from suffering, I say.
an7.54:5.1: An educated noble disciple does understand regrets, their origin, their cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation.
an7.54:5.2: And so their regrets cease. They’re freed from rebirth, old age, and death, from sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress. They’re freed from suffering, I say.
an7.54:5.3: Knowing and seeing this, an educated noble disciple does not answer: ‘A Realized One exists after death’ …
an7.54:5.4: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’
an7.54:5.5: Knowing and seeing this, an educated noble disciple does not declare the undeclared points.
an7.54:5.6: Knowing and seeing this, an educated noble disciple doesn’t shake, tremble, quake, or get nervous regarding the undeclared points.
an7.54:5.7: This is the cause, this is the reason why an educated noble disciple has no doubts regarding the undeclared points.”
